title: CycloneDX Standard Model
$comment: OWASP CycloneDX is an Ecma International standard (ECMA-424) developed in collaboration between the OWASP Foundation and Ecma Technical Committee 54 (TC54). The standard is published under a royalty-free patent policy. This JSON schema is the reference implementation and is licensed under the Apache License 2.0.

standards.title: Standards
standards.description: The list of standards which may consist of regulations, industry or organizational-specific standards, maturity models, best practices, or any other requirements which can be evaluated against or attested to.

standard.title: Standard
standard.description: A standard may consist of regulations, industry or organizational-specific standards, maturity models, best practices, or any other requirements which can be evaluated against or attested to.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description: An identifier which can be used to reference the object elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the standard. This will often be a shortened, single name of the standard.

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: The owner of the standard, often the entity responsible for its release.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: The list of requirements comprising the standard.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description: An identifier which can be used to reference the object elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The unique identifier used in the standard to identify a specific requirement. This should match what is in the standard and should not be the requirements bom-ref.

text.title: Text
text.description: The textual content of the requirement.

descriptions.title: Descriptions
descriptions.description: The supplemental text that provides additional guidance or context to the requirement, but is not directly part of the requirement.

openCre.title: OWASP OpenCRE Identifier(s)
openCre.description: The Common Requirements Enumeration (CRE) identifier(s). CRE is a structured and standardized framework for uniting security standards and guidelines. CRE links each section of a resource to a shared topic identifier (a Common Requirement). Through this shared topic link, all resources map to each other. Use of CRE promotes clear and unambiguous communication among stakeholders.

parent.title: Parent BOM Reference
parent.description: The `bom-ref` to a parent requirement. This establishes a hierarchy of requirements. Top-level requirements must not define a parent. Only child requirements should define parents.

levels.title: Levels
levels.description: The list of levels associated with the standard. Some standards have different levels of compliance.

bom-ref.title: BOM Reference
bom-ref.description: An identifier which can be used to reference the object elsewhere in the BOM. Every `bom-ref` must be unique within the BOM.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The identifier used in the standard to identify a specific level.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: The list of requirement `bom-ref`s that comprise the level.
